titles: The Moores baffled being a discourse concerning Tanger, especially when it was under the Earl of Teviot : by which you may find what methods and government is fittest to secure that place against the Moors : in a letter from a learned person (long resident in that place) at the desire of a person of quality.
author: Addison, Lancelot, 1632-1703.
notes: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
keywords: Teviot, Andrew Rutherford, --  Earl of, d. 1664.
